A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Uh\, guys... I think I just saw The Empire Strikes Back all over again. I've seen the negative reviews here on Rotten Tomatoes and wanted to dismiss them\, but it's true. ALL OF IT. From the opening onwards\, I find that there is too much forced humour for what should have been the darkest part of the trilogy. Snoke's reveal was terrible. I was expecting someone as menacing as Emperor Palpatine\, but instead we got Goldmember. There's also a lot of slapping in this movie\, which is ultimately what us\, the fans got for their money; a slap in the face. You don't even need to watch Episode IX to know how it ends. The First Order is defeated\, and Kylo Ren is brought back to the light side of the force. After all\, there's only one person controlling Kylo Ren's destiny now; himself.
